label: 平等院
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 2:  Heian Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1999
説明文: A temple in Uji famous for the Amida Hall, or Hōōdō, built by Fujiwara no Yorimichi in 1053, which when viewed with its surrounding landscape was intended to be a re-creation of Pure Land in this world (p. 513). [宇治、阿弥陀堂、鳳凰堂、藤原頼通]
